name: All Is Dust
description: All Is Dust is a first-person horror game for PC and Oculus Rift. Experience the terror of a dust storm in the 1930s and unravel the mystery surrounding your decaying farm.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core i3 5015 Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia GTX 470 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 2 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core i7 4770 Memory: 16 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia GTX 660 2GB DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 2 GB available space

reviews.review_text: A truly scary game, you hear footsteps behind you and then you turn around and...  ALLISDUST.EXE HAS STOPPED WORKING  That really made me ♥♥♥♥ my pants.

To begin with,  I'd give this game a neutral rating  if one were to exist. The first time, I have to admit that I got scared, but then everything was getting predictable because it was just another copy of the game like Slender / SCP. In itself, the game is worthy of attention primarily because it is very short, the average playing time is about 30 minutes. Unfortunately, it has many shortcomings, I happened to go (accidentally) through the wall or at some point fired into the air, also you can see from afar like a lighthouse glowing eyes of the enemies, which in my case reduces the fun of scare up. However, this game is free. Do you have a lot free time? Download and try this out.
Game is significantly bugged and the voice acting is terrible. The only part that really impressed me was the menu screen, to be honest.
Little game with little story. Pretty cheap jumpscares, that becomes repetitive along the way. For a free game worth a try, I think.
Like Slender, but unique setting with some nice effects. Free, and worth your time.

Upon seeing a new free horror game released on steam i of course, had to play it and let me tell you, this game is so godamn bad. that its good like legit i was laughing my ♥♥♥ off through half the game. The story told by some redneck makes no ♥♥♥♥ing sense, i still have no idea how the monsters work, the games only 30 minutes long and consists of you grabbing random objects around an inbred plantation and quickly running as fast as you can back to cledus's farmhouse. i just...xD honestly this game isnt scary and i'm not just saying that cuz im a horror game veteran, this game would make kids laugh (seriously) and the only reason im recomending it was i had alot of fun just trying to figure out what this game even is, and honestly you should play it even if you don't like horror games xD

Game crashes, but if it worked I would say it is a good game. Scared the hell out of me, untill it stopped working. I hope I can make it work, kind of sucks to get so far into the game and have it crash on you losing your game. I want to give it a thumbs up but since it won't work it gets a thumbs down.
Wow too scary for me.... good job.
Wish it was longer.. I beat the game in 2 hours.. For a horror game its not scary at all imo. If you want a quick game to kill time I would recommnd this one.

All Is Dust is worth playing mostly because it's so short. If you're looking for quick, chea,p scares this game has them, although like many games in the genre this game has its flaws.  I was quite suprised by the graphics of this game. The visuals are quite nice to look at, and I believe it's because this game sticks to a consistent art style, with none of the assets feeling out of place. The lighting effects also are quite good for a game like this, and go a long way in improving the visuals. Don't get me wrong, the graphics in this game aren't triple A quality, and have some problems. For instance, the corn crops suffer from terrible pop-in often appearing right in front of me as I wandered throughout the farm. However, the graphics in this game are better than many other indie horror games i've seen. The gameplay is a mixed bag with this game. Like most other horror games, this game does a good job at building the atmosphere in the beginning. I was actually starting to see stuff out of the corner of my eye as i dreaded when the monster would appear. However, once the monster does appear things start to go downhill. The monster is a mix of slenderman and SCP-173. It stalks you just as the slenderman did in slender, and like SCP-173 it will attack you if you cease looking at it. Therefore as you wander the farm, you must listen to the monsters footsteps and put it in your field of view to prevent it from attacking you. This does work for a short time, and the monster encounters were tense for awhile. But unfortunately the gameplay then begins to decline. As the game progresses the monster just becomes annoying as you must walk backwards, unable to see where you're going, just to avoid being hit. Eventually more of these monsters will appear, and while i assume this was to make things scarier, it's actually just annoying. You'll be hit from all directions until you just start spinning the camera around frantically yelling at the monsters to leave you alone. The story at first doesn't seem worth mentioning. It's your typical demonic cult type thing, and seems pretty throw away. The only reason i mention the story at all is because If you pay attention you may end up with your own interpretation of it like I did, especially if you know something about the time period.  There are some other flaws i should mention. First off the camera is terrible (at least on controller) and initally would spin around like my character was some guy hopped up on cocaine or something (given the events that you witness, this isn't too unlikely). Also sometimes i would receive button prompts for keyboard even though I was playing on the controller. Also, this game suffers from the 'Why am i doing this' problem that plenty of these slender type games do. Why am i collecting these fragments again? Why did i throw a key into the bottom of a well? BECAUSE ♥♥♥♥ING DEMONS, THAT'S WHY!  Luckily this game is short enough that it doesn't out stay it's welcome. If it were longer, it's flaws would probably ruin the experience. I do want to see more from this developer, and hopefully this will be a learning experience for them.
It tried to be scary, but the enemies are hilarious looking and you basically can't get killed.
Suck like atilla total war
I recommend Getting this game it was very fun and has a short little story.  I loved every second of it and hope it will be continued in the near future.
I've had nothing but bad experiences with this game crashing on me. Could not enjoy one moment of glitch free gameplay.
This game seems very intersting and I was kinda hooked after playing for the small amount I was able to...BUT, the crashes. In the 10 minutes that I played this, I had 6 crashes!
AAAAARRRRRRRRGGGGGGGGHHHHHHHHHHHH THIS GAME IS REALLY SCARY AAAAARRRRRRRRGGGGGGHHHHHHHHH HELP!!!!!

This was a fun, short, little free to play horror game.   The storyline and timeline were unique. Early 1930s out in the dusty plains. A perfect setup for a good horror story.  I will reluctantly reccomend this game to most people because today's gamers are looking for instant satisfaction and top quality out of products. This looks like a small time dev and a first production. Overall it has all the peices to be a great game. With some work on the models and textures, some added story, and a little touch-up on the voice over it has a lot of potential.  6/10

I actually like the concept BuT their are a few things I must complain about.  1. The ability to adjust controller sensitivity should be put in. I use a XBox 360 controller and when I use the analogs my POV goes into a barely controllable spin. I looked on two occasions and found no OPTIONS.  2. For some reason after I select keyboard controllers I cant do anything. Not even Esc to a menu and exit. I have to Alt F4 out.  3.Noticed a few glitchy graphics.  In all I do like the concept but at this point it is far to buggy. I will keep an eye out for future updates and give it another try.
The man in the beginning sounds like Bill Clinton.  6/10 Monica Lewinski's up.

The atmosphere hooked me immediately. (It looks great on a screen, even better in VR.) Driving late at night through the dust bowl during the great depression, storm on the horizon, sand etching and grinding at the car windows. This game starts strong, and the realism put into the background setting really kept me interested the whole way through, even if the storyline ended up being hazy and felt unfinished. Great design on the scarecrows, especially the glints on the eyes here and there, was also digging the long, spindly shadows inside the cabin. Nightmares for days, ya'll. Overall, a good, quick playing story-game that's worth a playthrough for the great sense of atmosphere, even if the plot itself is lacking.

It took me 16 minutes to beat the game. This game was made by a small team of developers but if you are going to put a game on steam, you better be prepared for criticism. First of all this game is crap. You run around a barn picking crap up being chased by a no-legged demon. The voice acting is cringe-worthy and the game crashes every chapter. Normally I would say its free what do you have to lose, but in this case, you lose a lot. They basically bend you over and ass♥♥♥♥ you. 11/10 would buy full price.

Wow, well, I'm a coward and so this had my heart racing throughout. I left the doors open in the house so the were banging throughout which actually added to the game so I recommend having someone make unnecessary noise around you while you play! I also enjoyed the special floating blood that was smeared across the open space of an empty doorway.  This is the first game of this type that I have played but it had a clear element of slenderman. It had me on edge the whole time, my nerves were a wreck because you constantly feel paranoid that you are being followed and don't know when to run! It's a nice short game with the beginning of a story and then bits of story and I enjoyed the style of the cut scenes. It partially wrapped it up at the end but it never reeeeally explains what the outcome is. I would exlain from my point of view more but I don't want to spoil the game although it is then obvious where the little girl is which gave me a nice moment where I felt like I had accomplished something even though it is probably obvious to others prety quickly!  It's a creepy game that still has my heart racing now with an interesting story but that's about it. As it is free I would recommend it however it did crash three times which is why it took me over an hour to complete which was frustrating. It's a thumbs up from me... just.

My Experience in All is Dust:  Download Game Start Game Start playing  'Oh this is a nice car', 'WTF is he talking about', 'OH ♥♥♥♥!' (Car Crash)  Miraculousy survive. 10/10 medics. For some reason I am on a farm during a dust storm.  Go outside. Follow blue ghost thing. (Named him Casper)  Find a well. Need a crank. Press M She I need to go over to a field to get said crank.  When I arrive at the field, I see a big scary monster that looks like he is covered in BBQ sauce on a cross. Lovely. See crank. Grab crank, and turn around. Mr. Spook has gotten himself down and decided to follow me. 10/9 Slender RIP.  Go to well. Install crank. Get key. Open door.  Cinematic about a book.  Respawn in house with a lantern.  Go to barn. Climb a ladder. Collect page. Turn around. Mr. Spook came back.  8/8 g8 r8 8 m8 - IGN Jumpscares. Game crash. Change pants. Uninstall.  -Serious-  Its a good F2P game about a creature that jumpscares you. Pretty much Slender. Good game for people just starting to play Horror.

The idea is... OK, it is a little less than that actually. It was made in unity, and ive seen some amazing games made in unity, this one has poor models, not all of them, but most and by most I mean like 95% of them. The 'Monster' Model in the game is not scary, the jump scares in the game are just that. Not much suspense, it isn't a great game at all. Maybe if it wasn't on steam and it was just like a game online. It doesn't change the fact that it is free of course, however getting eaten alive on steam amongst already garbage free to plays isn't the life this small time game and dev needs.
Well started off game stopped working restarted game constant 180-360 degree turns to stop them demons attacking you great game 10/10 would play again only took 29 minutes
Can't even start this game just freezes after the unity logo. I'd give this game a .00001/100 rating if I could.

Upon beating this game, I was at 21 minutes. When I started the game, I was already at 2 minutes, due to having to try a couple of different things to get it to run. So, it took 19 minutes to play through the entire game. My second run through the game took 10 minutes (I wanted to monitor RAM usage during a playthrough). That's not necessarily a bad thing. The game is free, and sometimes I want something I can play quickly with little to no real investment.   The controls were fine, even using a controller. At first, it seemed as though the in-game messages were locked to keyboard controls (it was telling me to press 'F' to pick things up). But, this fixed itself a bit later in the game, and switched the messages to the controller layout.  As I stated above, I played the game a second time in order to monitor my memory usage. I'm running a GTX 970, and I watched both the memory usage of the video card and the usage on my PC's memory. At the most I saw a jump to around 1500 MB on the video card, and a 500 MB jump on the PC's RAM. The reason I bring this up is the incredibly high stated requirements on the store page. With a minimum requirement of 8 GB and a recommended requirement of 16 GB, this could turn people away from trying the game when they may very well be able to run it with little issue.  Technical discussions aside, this is supposed to be a horror game, and I feel that is where it falters. There is no sense of dread. Sure, there are monsters, and they do become more prominent after each cut scene, but they're not scary. They only give chase when your back is turned to them, and disappear in a puff of dust when you near them with your lantern. This makes them incredibly simple to manage as you make your way around the farmhouse, and quickly gives the player a sense of invincibility that destroys any semblance of terror that could have been built.  So, is this game worthwhile? Sadly, no. Free does not mean that a game is exempt from critique. And this game fails at being what it sets out to be, which is a horror game. It brings nothing new to the table, and doesn't even get the fundamentals right. Horror, no matter what, should make one feel helpless in some way. This is why the newer Resident Evil titles are looked down on. They removed the sense of helplessness that the original titles had. There is nothing scary in a game where your lantern is essentially a weapon with unlimited ammunition, and simply looking at the big bad is enough to freeze it permanently.  It's just not horror when the monsters are more afraid of you then you are of them.

For reals, the only thing scary about this game is the horrendous lack of playability - it's like a glitch simulator, but that's only if you manage to get the damn thing up and running without it crashing on you every 5 minutes or so. If that doesn't tell you everything you need to know about this game then consider this: every minute you spend attempting to play this steaming pile of donkey flop is one less minute you have left to live, a minute that you'll never get back and only the most expensive therapist will be able to heal the psychological scarring left behind once you've gazed upon the disembodied, bearded floaty head man! What!? You don't believe me, just check out the pic I posted (of course, you'll only gaze upon his horrific visage if you manage to play this game for about 15 min......that was all I could personally handle....oh wait, that's right, that's as far as I managed to get before the game crashed for like the 50th time).  Consider yourself warned....

WARNING - CONTAINS SPOILERS       Cant say whether or not you should download this game. Do so at your own risk. To its credit the concept is awesome and unique (as far as survival horror games go, I'm pretty sure we've seen something similar spit out by Hollywood at some point, doesn't it look like a cross between Resident Evil, Paranormal Activity and Of Mice and Men?) and I was really hoping for an eerie experience set in the 1930'S American South.  Unfortunately the exciting concept is shattered by the same monotenous gameplay elements and and the exact feel seen in just about every indie survival horror since Slender. Go here. Go there. Collect this. You dont even have the challenge of having to find everything yourself (Which could add potential hours of gameplay to build atmosphere), you have a map that conveniently points out all of the cult's activity sites on your farm. It's almost like they GAVE you that map and wanted to be stopped.   The story is disturbingly linear and the antagonist is so easily thwarted that it plunges into the realm of a simple annoyance with a scary face. I mean you could walk right up to it and it seems to become more paralyzed with fear than you. The fact that it simply stands there and doesn't do anything completely shatters the atmosphere and and has you wondering how this game earned the title 'survival horror'. Youre never in any real danger and the monster can be shooed away like a bothersome fly.   So far as sound design goes the game is also severely lacking. No BAFTA for you. I imagine the developers were going for a realistic feel with the disturbing amount of silence, which is admirable, brave, but unfortunaly a bad move. Sound is 50% of the game experience, you might as well make it good. The game lacks the short little instrumental riffs to immerse you in the time and setting, and there's also no ambience. If anything, at least add ambience. creepy, unnatural sounds, disturbing, bassy drones, the spectral, eerie whispers that enriched the atmosphere of Eternal Darkness: Sanity's Requiem. The short truth is that although silence may be realistic, as far as any media experience goes its just empty and makes you feel like an awkward scene from a cheesy soapie is unfolding before you.  I had really high hopes for this game, I was really excited and I'm still a fan of the concept explored. Creepy cult activity, an eerie monster that lurks in the corn (or should, because that would make it alot creepier), blood coated walls and fields of burning Crosses, its all very unsettling. But as original as it seems, its suprisingly not original. Just looking at the screenshots and gameplay vids one can see the arm and lantern schtick was ripped directly from more successful, big budget titles like the Amnesia series. It feels like youre playing Slender: Dustbowl Edition, minus all the scary ambience that made it what it was. The game lures you in with well scripted, dynamic menus, only to disappoint you with gameplay that doesnt live up to it.

I do not reccomend this game at all. I couldn't even get it to run proporly most of the time. Issues I had initially was OBS recording it, instantly crashing it. After that, with my headset plugged in, all audio come out at max volume is a clipping static.  I gave up after that with my ears ringing. 0/5 Don't waste your time here.
what was the purpose of this 10 minute game? I didnt even understand it at the end.
This was purely a demo for the occulus and should be dl purely by those owning it.....it's bad,no menu,no settings etc

Best free game ever! Immersive, scary and surprising-looking monster and such a unique combat system! The story is brilliant, the lack of esc menu is nothing short of magnificent andthe crashes are to die for. Simply the best game of 2015!
only promblem i have with this game is when i alt-tap i have to restart my computer just so the game will close
Can't even start this game just freezes after the unity logo. I'd give this game a .00001/100 rating if I could.
This game scared the crap out of me #PotatoInMyPants i couldnt see wgwere the enemies im not sure if youur supposed 2 but dont play this 10/10 would uninstall gain 10/10 would cry in a bathtub again
thank god it was free
some people might like it i just hated it

Don't bother downloading this. I have a fairly high-end system but the game still stutters like crazy. Even worse, the character turns at an astonishingly slow rate. You also have no way to adjust any settings whatsoever in the game. I'm not sure how this actually got released.
24 minutes of my life spent collecting newspaper... 0/10 would not collect newspaper again
Cornfield Simulator 2015. Very boring game that isn't scary in the least, bad voice acting, and a complete waste of time.
Almost fell asleep because of the narrator voice,  can't sleep anymore after encountering first monster   10/10 would buy new pants
i havent tryed the game yet cuz it keeps crashing when i try to start my video recorder for my youtube channel any ideas on how to run the game in windowed mode?

When I first started playing, it genuinely felt creepy; and the first encounter with the monster was chilling. However, after about the second chapter, the monster was pretty dull and predictable. I think the devs realized this and tried to compensate by adding in more of these monsters; in which my opinion, made the game less creepy. Very abrupt and predictable ending as well. Over all, I'd give it about a 4/10. If you're into Slenderman/SCP games, give it a try. It is free after all.
10/10 would be confused by jump scares again

1/10. There is no pause menu. In fact, no pause at all. The only way to exit the game is by pulling up the task manager. The game changed my computer's display resolution, rather than adjusting the game's resolution to fit my computer's settings, or better yet, let me set it myself. It asked me if I wanted to use a game pad, or keyboard. So assuming it supported the game pad, I chose that. When I push the stock forwards, my guy walks at an angle to the right. There is no way to change control settings or adjust the sensitivity, and it takes about 20-30 seconds for the guy to turn 360 degrees. So when you are walking down the path, and there is a turn,.. You stop whatever it is you are doing, Roll a joint. Grab a beer. Get a bag of Dorritos. And prepare for the long hual. Crack your knuckles. Adjust your nut sack. Push that stick to the left, and hold it... hold it... hold it... hold it... hold it... hold it... hold it... hold it...

I played this whole game, it's very short and has no options or settings which can make the sound alittle annoying at times but all together it's a good game. If you don't want to play it or download it but still see the whole game mine and other videos of it from start to finish are aviable but once you watch those you will have no reason to play this since it's a very liniar game meant to tell a story. Overall it's worth downloading for a fun dark night alone but the horror factor fades quickly which doesn't matter cause the game will be over by the time it stops being scary anyway play it
Apart from being a little bit scary, this game has pretty bad quality. Also there is no log out screen to it at all so you basically get stuck in the game once you start.
Some good ideas But game is way 2 Amateur

Didn't finish the game. Got bored around the 2nd chapter.   Pros:  Strong hook, starving daughters, failing farms, and swindling satanists.   Monster is really creepy at first.   You have no idea what you're doing, so needing to check the map while a monster's is staring at you is intense.    Cons:  No pause menu (which I suppose is a really stupid stylistic choice), no graphics options, no mouse sensitivity slider, default mouse sensitivity sucks ♥♥♥.   Amazingly vague objectives. You won't have any idea what you're doing.   Monster gets really not creepy.
This game isn't multiplayer ...
Very nice game with catchy atmosphere, feels alot like Amnesia.

Long story short, the scarecrow guy touches you for the lulz. You die for the lulz. JK.  All is Dust is about a man and his dead daughter and their farm, which decays overtime. Some exorcists come and do stuffs, then farmer sees that they do stuffs and well, farmer does stuffs. And scarecrow guys molest you from the back. And sides.   The game is not really scary, I give you that. It's just the scarecrow touching you again and again. And for those who don't like being touched, it might be a trauma for them.  So, the game was well, actually decent for a free game (just considering the story line and not the graphics and mechanics). So well. Yeah, worth a try because it's free. :D
great short hour long game the monster wasent that scary but the game its self had good jump scares. Try out the game its really worth it.
cant even start what a waste of space

Not scary, not fun, not entertaining. No options menu when you're playing, pressing escape to get a menu and exit doesn't even exist when playing. I know it's free, but frankly it was just a waste of time and hard drive space. Uninstalling.
Game would be fine if I could play it for longer than 5 minutes before it crashed on my computer that can handle any PC game currently available. Okay.
I was having an okay time, that is, until i tried to get away, and i got stuck in a tree and had to restart.

Basically a knock off of slenderman. I didn't play it long, but it just seemed meh. I couldn't get my guy to sprint no matter how long I held down shift. It didn't feel complete, as I could walk through basically any object that wasn't a fence. In addition to all that, the opening 'cut scene' type deal had a cringeworthy 'southern' accent. I put southern in quotes, because I think that's what he was going for, but it wasn't anywhere near a southern accent. I would give it a little more time, but I kept getting thrown out of the game and it kinda screwed with my computer so I'm deleting it now.
I got stuck between two of the KKK's crosses.   10/10 would uninstall again

Atmosphere was eerie, sound was eerie. I was on my toes at the start of the game, but then the map happened. The map kept blocking my vision, taking up at least 85% of the screen. I couldn't see where the diabolical monster was nor see Patricia's drawing.  Speaking of the diabolical monster, it wasn't that menacing and diabolical.    But you ain't got no legs Lt. Dan    It was extremely slow, I must've missed the first jumpscare as I kept spinning due to Patricia's drawing and the map being stapled to my forehead.  I don't mind the graphics. The sound was spooky.  The game, not that much. Unless you like crippled monsters stalking you from afar.
I'm sad to know this made it onto Steam.
